fields.description:
We've had the occassional issue that's been closed with the wrong "Fixed In" version against it.  Originally the issue was targetted for one version, but somebody got the urge to fix it sooner and it made it into an earlier version; however, they didn't notice it had the wrong version against it when they resolved the issue.  One side effect of this is the issue doesn't appear in the Changes Log, and even when it does eventually appear it'll be against the wrong version.  So, in the interests of accuracy, I want to change it back to the correct version.

Unfortunately, even with administrator privileges, the only way to do this is to re-open the issue then close it again, which is a bit cumbersome.  It would be nice if this were made more streamlined e.g. by allowing administrators to Edit certain fields even in closed issues (actually, that's about the only field I can think of which would benefit from being able to do this, since you can still add Comments already)
fields.summary: Allow Fixed In field to be edited without reopening issue

fields.description: When finding issues restricted to a particular fix for version, the resulting data set contains data from other versions.
fields.summary: Finding issues with "Fix For" filter not restricting found set

fields.description: We are on release 1.4.2.  A prior version let you search on the Summary field via a text search.  this was very powerful but now the field is no longer there.  Is this a configurable search field or will we see it in a future version.
fields.summary: Text search field

fields.description: When viewing an issue, in the areas where the linked issues are listed for each type of link, please can the list be sorted by Issue ID?
fields.summary: Sorted Issue Links

fields.description: Looking at the RSS view of a set of issues, the title tag isn't being populated in EAP 6
fields.summary: No title in RSS for EAP
Attachments don't show in the Full Content View

fields.description:
I exported my JIRA data and reinstalled the standalone 2.0EAP5 app from scratch.  At setup, I import the data file and log in.

Everything seems to work, but somehow my issues (only three currently) are semi-transparent.

On my main page, I can see the little graphic issue outlines for the two projects that have issues.  I see a little green bar on one, and a part green/part red bar on another.  I have a task assigned to me, but I do not see it under "Issues:Assigned to You".  If I browse any of the projects that contained an issue, they all say zero for everything - no unassigned, no closed, no opened, etc.

If I do a find and try to view all issues relating to a project (that explicitly show a graph on the homepage), I get no results.

If I do a find for ALL PROJECTS, I see the three tasks in my database.

Any ideas?
fields.summary: Export of 2.0 to new install has issues, but not visible in browse project

fields.description:
I have tried to use the introduced work log feature to log the work done on issues in order to build up some estimation history - but so far we have not succeded.
One of the challenges we have had is that the work log operates in calender days which are quite confusing - depicted by this example:
If I create an issue and we estimate it to last one day - we set the initial estimate to 1d. The developer works on the issue for one day and reports that he has used 8 hours (= one working day) - then Jira tells him that he still has 16 hours left of the estimated time.
I could ask the development team to report work logged by days - but then they have to remember to log a half days work as 12 hours.
This is confusing - I have locally worked on changing the Jira representation so 1w = 5d (workdays) and 1d = 8h (one working day) which definately looks nicer.

What I would suggest is a general preference so people can adjust hours/day days/week to make the work log work the way they prefer.
fields.summary: Worklog to use working days/weeks etc.

fields.description: Listeners / Email Listener which is referred to in the documentation doesn't have an preference editing option
fields.summary: Can't edit Listener properties
Urls in description/comment fields dont get properly href'ed

fields.description:
Using the JIRA installation at jira.werken.com (Version: 1.4.3-#22), a number of times when trying to view lists of issues, the table of results is cutting off before the end.  It's not that I'm losing the HTTP connection and truncating the page as the footer text is still returned after it, with the result that the browser renders it all in the next table cell (and has a large grey rectangle in the remaining area to the right of it).

Trying to sort the table by different columns by clicking on the headings, I found it was being cut off at different points.  In fact, at one point after sorting by summary and paging through to the last page of results, it got cut off before it had even finished the table headings...

It may just be an environment issue with their installation, but I thought I'd bring it up here too in case it's a more general problem.  A couple of examples of pages which were affected are:
http://jira.werken.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?pid=10030&sorter/field=reporter&component=-1&sorter/order=DESC&reset=true&mode=hide&resolutionIds=-1
and
http://jira.werken.com/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?start=40
(hmm, I notice that one doesn't contain any parameters for project etc. so that one may not work).  If you like, I could attach some screenshots showing the behaviour, too.
fields.summary: Lists of issues not finishing table

fields.description:
Most email clients add a 'In-Reply-To: <messageid>' header, when replying to a message.  This allows the client to keep track of mail threads.  It would be nice if JIRA added this header to email notifications, so that all mails relating to a certain issue would be grouped in a thread.  In established projects, 80% of the traffic is bug reports and updates, and such a feature would make a big difference.

--Jeff
fields.summary: Add threading to notification emails

fields.description: When deleting a notification specified on a custom notification scheme, the resulting page (/secure/admin/DeleteNotification!default.jspa) simply says "Are you sure you want to delete this notification", but does not tell you WHICH notification you are confirming the deletion of.  Some text to clarify would be nice.
fields.summary: Delete notification on custom scheme needs clarification

fields.description:
When an admin creates a custom field of type "date", the user is presented with a text field and it just says "enter a date in this format".

Would be nicer if you could include the calendar popup link such as you use elsewhere in the application.
fields.summary: Include "calendar popup" for custom fields of type date

fields.description: The size of the e-mail fields on many of the forms are too small.  For example: Edit Profile page, Create New User page.
fields.summary: Size of e-mail fields are too small

fields.description:
Small security backdoor.

Use Case to Reproduce Issue:

1) Create a group, "clients", that only has access to create issues, with no other permissions
2) Create a user that is only a member of the new "clients" group
4) Create a global filter, "Recently Updated Issues", for all tasks updated in last 24 hours, available to all users
5) Log in as your user
6) In the Saved Filters list, click "Recently Updated Issues"

Although the user does not have browse permissions, they can see the results of the global filter.  If they click any of the issues in the list, an error is returned.
fields.summary: User with only create permissions can view issue list via global filters

fields.description:
When you activate Issue Linking, when you view issues they now all include the "Issue Links" field.

If the issue has no links, it shows the text "There are no issue links at the moment".

This field should either
1) be hidden if the issue has no links, until a developer adds a linked issue, or
2) for users who are allowed to link issues show text such as "<u>Add a link</u> to this issue".

Preferably a combination of the two.  ;)
fields.summary: Hide "Issue Links" field if linking enabled, and issue has no link

fields.description:
We wanted to change the default names of groups that come with JIRA 1.4.3.  So I exported the data, and did a global search and replace of all instances of "jira-developers" with "Developers".  Then I imported the data.

When I do this, I can see the "Developers" group from the group browser list, but if I try to view the users in this group it is blank.

Also, if you try to edit groups for a user, you'll see all your group names in the two membership lists (for join and leave), but when you try to add a group, an exception will be thrown.

To fix, I had to go in and rename the "Developers" group to "developers" and it works fine.  Looks like certain parts of the app are coded to use a lowercase group name, and mixed case group names throw it off.
fields.summary: Group names cannot contain mixed case

fields.description: If I browse a project, then click on a developer, it shows me all the Unresolved Issues, not just the ones for that requested developer.
fields.summary: Clicking on the issues for a developer doesn't work

fields.description:
I'm having problems with binary attachments (Word Files): they get damaged on download. I tracked the problem down to this (in web.xml)

    <filter-mapping>
        <filter-name>security</filter-name>
        <url-pattern>/*</url-pattern>
    </filter-mapping>

which also applies to /security/attachment. Commenting it out helps (but obviously raises other problems)
fields.summary: Downloading binary attachments damages content
Sort issues differently depending on fixForVersion

fields.description: It would be immensily useful to be able to sort issues in the order of urgency, just like releases are scheduled. This would make it really easy to see what is next on the list of things to do.
fields.summary: Sort issues in the order of urgency

fields.description: I would like to be able to edit existing comments for an issue. Currently, to fix a typo on a comment, it has to be deleted and then re-entered. If editing of issues is allowed, then perhaps editing of comments should be allowed to?
fields.summary: Ability to Edit Comments

fields.description:
Log into JIRA. Click "Log Out" link  -> "Log In Again" link -> "Forgot Password" link -> "Log In" link -> Fill in username/password, click "Log In" button -> You get logged in with the top navigation showing BUT the main content screen shows the forgotten password form which asks for the email address of the user.

Confused the hell out of me when I found this out.
fields.summary: Login form shows "forgotten password" form after logging in (test)

fields.description:
If JIRA is configured to use a non-existing email address as the global sender address, no email is sent and no error message is printed to the JIRA users. Javax.mail prints the following exception in this case:

javax.mail.SendFailedException: Sending failed;
  nested exception is:
        javax.mail.MessagingException: 553 5.3.0 <jira@sulake.com>... No such user.

        at javax.mail.Transport.send0(Transport.java:219)
        at javax.mail.Transport.send(Transport.java:81)
        at com.atlassian.jira.event.listeners.mail.MailSender.send(MailSender.java:102)

IMHO, in this case JIRA should either be able to send the email despite the wrong sender address OR warn the server adminstrator that something is wrong.
fields.summary: If JIRA email sender address doesn't exist, no email is sent

fields.description:
Cannot specify a username and password to use for SMTP connections so all notifications are dropped on the floor by server.

Anyone not relaying should have this issue if they are denying all relays and have SMTP Auth turned on.
fields.summary: SMTP Auth not supported for notifications

fields.description: Jira will create links for urls that it recognizes (eg, http://bla). For the case of complex urls, it would be nicer to be able specify both the url and a link-name to display instead of the url.
fields.summary: Custom field type of URL (or <a/>

fields.description: I defined a custom field of type 'Text field' which can have 255 characters. But in the edit issue page the edit field is only about 20 characters wide. It could at least expand to take up all the width.
fields.summary: Enlarge custom field edit field

fields.description:
I'm getting this exception at startup (tomcat 4.1.18). I copied all the files in etc/server/tomcat into $CATALINA_HOME/common/lib.

Why do we need to put any libraries in common/lib?

-----

fields.summary: Log4j serialization problem

fields.description:
I keep seem to be getting the message (in red)  "Current filter modified since loading"  in the top filter panel. It seems to happen for several scenarios, but here is the one I just did.

1. Login
2. Click "Find Issues"
3. Select "unresolved" as the only filter. Selected "All Projects".
4. Clicked "View and Hide"
5. Clicked "Save" filter; named and saved the filter. Now I see the filter name that I just saved in the top filter panel
6. Click "Home", Select "Outstanding" for a project

Now the message is displayed in top filter panel.

At this point its not clear whether the text in red is indicating an error or what. But the issues list is always empty, and I don't see any way to turn off the filter or just have jira do what I told it (ie, show all outstanding for a specific project).
fields.summary: Filter state seems to be getting confused

fields.description:
I was editing priorities:

1. I renamed "Critical" -> "High", ...
2. I deleted "Trivial", reassigning all issues to "Low" (was just renamed above)

When the priorities page was redisplayed "Trivial" was gone, but all the renames were reverted.
fields.summary: Changing priority cache/update problem

fields.description:
In the administration interface, Mail Servers section doesn't provide an interface to add a new SMTP server or edit the existing SMTP settings.

Also, the Listeners / Email Listener which is referred to in the documentation doesn't have an preference editing option.

(Using a fresh Standalone installation.)
fields.summary: Can't edit SMTP server settings

fields.description: I have created a notification scheme and added a 'mail to single email address' for each event.  I have also setup my SMTP server.  For some reason, we are unable to get the notifications sent to our mailing list.  I know the SMTP is working properly because there was one project that suddenly decided to start sending notifications to a creator.
fields.summary: Notifications not being sent

fields.description: With EAP5, if you browse issues that have more than one page, the next link will not show the next page of links, the current page is just reshown.
fields.summary: Unable to browser to next page of issues

fields.description: In our MyVest system we have an issue Eagle-83 that you cannot assign, edit, delete .  What causes the defect to appear this way.  I need to close this defect.
fields.summary: Issue has no buttons to close or assign

fields.description:
When creating a service, and not filling in anything, the error messages do not end with a dot, while all others do.

Please specify a name for this service

Please specify a class for this service
fields.summary: Service creation error messages contain no dots

fields.description:
When creating a bug, then editing, changing the component or version, the Change History contains duplicate values for a single change.

For example:

Field     Original                New

Component                         Documentation [10005]
Component Admin GUI [10000]

while it should be one line

Field     Original                New

Component Admin GUI [10000]       Documentation [10005]
fields.summary: Change History duplicate entries

fields.description:
in dashboard.jsp, change

<jsp:include page="<%="/portlets/dashboard/introduction.jsp"%>" />

to

<jsp:include page="/portlets/dashboard/introduction.jsp" />

(probably introduced by a wrong conversion from a static include to the dynamic version, this works in Tomcat, but not in Jetty)
fields.summary: jsp:include tag wrongly formatted

fields.description: Can reset the password, but user doesn't get email. Email issue is not yours, but admins need the ability to change and / or review user passwords.
fields.summary: Can't change or review user password

fields.description:
An error occurred searching: com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchException: Permission denied

This is the error that I get when I try to do a search on any new issue in a new project that I create.
fields.summary: SearchException: Permission denied

fields.description:
Currently when a user of the system does not have access to a specific project that user is able to see the project on the 'BrowseProject.jspa'  page.

If a user does not have access to a project, why should they even be able to see the project?

Imagine using this to allow a customer to view the process of a product that is being worked on but also seeing the other projects that exist. This may conflict with NDA in place with existing customers.
fields.summary: 'Browse Projects' security restriction on browse project page

fields.description:
I am the administrator of several inhouse projects. I would like to be able to to some easy updates to existing and new issues without opening every issue:

In a list of issues I would like to change
- Assignment
- Priority
- Component
- Version
- Fix for version
- Status
- Estimated time
- Worked time
WITHIN that list without opening the issues (like working in a spreadsheet)

PLUS:
In case I need to edit several issues of a project I would like to have a button which bring me back to the last project view I was in (e.g. list of issues of an component or release). This would save me a lot of key-strokes going forwards and backwards every time.
fields.summary: Easy administration of issues
"Link" needs to allow to browse for existing issues
Shareable subprojects

fields.description:
I'm trying to link an issue (a bug) to an issue (a task).  When I'm viewing the issue I select the "Link this issue to an existing issue." and get sent to a "link Existing Issue" page.  On this page I enter a Issue key and a comment and set viewable by to "All Users"  

The problem is the "This issue:" drop down box has no items in it.  I don't know what I'm missing here.  Where do I add a link description?  When I hit the "Link" button I get an "Invalid link description specified." error.

thanks,
Brant
fields.summary: Link Existing Issue (select the link description)

fields.description: Notification Scheme works fine. But when i using international characters in project name, issue body, etc, in received mail they looks like a question marks (???????)
fields.summary: Bug with international characters in mail notification

fields.description: Under the 'Assignee' field on the filter there is a new drop-down that includes 'Unassigned' - nice.  This means the text underneath does not need to be '(username - use "unassigned" to find unassigned issues)' any more, just (username).
fields.summary: Text 'use "unassigned" to find unassigned issues' no longer needed on filter

fields.description: Please could you add a Browse... button for the XML import / export screens.  I know you wouldn't always be able to browse as the file might be on the server, but when you can it would make life easier.
fields.summary: Add Browse... button for XML Import / export
Project|Open Issues: Too much gray area

fields.description: ... because it always shows 50 percent.
fields.summary: Personal Road Map: progress indicator is useless

fields.description: Currently when you perform a query of defects and you get more than 20 you need to perform muliple copies to the excel spreadsheet.  The excel export should function just like the printable function.  If you select Excel you should export the entire query results not just the current display.
fields.summary: Creating Excel lists

fields.description:
See attached files.

2.0 doesn't fix the international problems; actually ... it's worse :(

I thought il8n was supposed to be easy in Java? ;)

Last bug report for the night, I promise. I do need to sleep sometime.
fields.summary: Corrupted international text viewing an issue.

fields.description:
Creating a bug with an invalid Version chosen in the list will cause corruption of the 'Create Issue' page which is loaded next.

HTML for the page will be loaded into the Description, and some java tags (or something like that) appears at the top.

See attached screenshots.
fields.summary: invalid Version causes page corruption

fields.description:
-- PROBLEM --

Excerpt from readme:

1. edit '/webapp/WEB-INF/classes/entityengine.xml' for your server
2. run 'ant war' (builds a WAR) or 'ant ear' (builds an EAR)
2. deploy the resulting WAR or EAR in your application server

$ ant war

[...]

BUILD FAILED
file:/Users/chrome/src/jira/build.xml:46: /Users/chrome/src/jira/edit not found.

Total time: 6 seconds

-- FIX --

$ mkdir edit

Seems like the build.xml needs to create the dir if needed.
fields.summary: Cannot build JIRA as per readme file

fields.description:
Everything between the header and footer is duplicated.

So, for example, on a fresh install, there is two 'Setup JIRA' panels.

Confusingly, there is also a login panel, which doesn't happen for 1.4.3...

Very strange. It doesn't seem to matter which one I use, both 'forms' work.

Will try to attach an image ...

Marked as critical because while it is cosmetic, it's downright wrong :)

Has anyone else got this? Is it just the 2002/12/18 build? I'm going to try EAP3 and see if I get the same thing.
fields.summary: Duplication of interface elements

fields.description:
Other problems with Unicode becoming corrupted:

New issue page
--------------

If you create an issue 'correctly', the unicode is preserved and saved correctly. The view issue screen also works correctly.

However, if you select something incorrectly, such as 'Released Versions', any unicode text that has been entered will corrupt.

Filter page
-----------

Filters do not display the Summary correctly; they corrupt any unicode.

Edit issue page
---------------

If you edit an issue, the edit page will corrupt your unicode data.

Resolve issue page
------------------

Again, corrupted unicode.

Solution
--------

Whatever you're doing right on the Home page, do it on the other pages. The view issue page works correctly also.

Conclusion
----------

These are major problems for any company wanting to use your product, that is a multilingual environment.

We are very keen to use this product, as we believe it to be the best issue tracking system on the market, but as a Japanese company, we *need* to be able to reliably report on issues in Japanese. Anything less makes the product useless to us.

Personally, I will give you any help that you require in fixing this problems, so that we can purchase it. If you need me to try out new builds in my particular environment, then please feel free to e-mail me.

Asking me to 'try 2.0' is not a solution. This will be used in a production environment, and needs to be a fully functional, released, version. Not a beta that 'might' work.
fields.summary: Corrupted unicode in various pages.

fields.description: Cannot delete a user once it has been created, even through no issues have been opened or assigned to this user. (The user is brand new)
fields.summary: Cannot delete users

fields.description:
If you accidently add the system group 'Anyone' (or I suspect, any of the system groups) to any of the Global Permissions, you cannot remove them.

Again, we'd like to buy JIRA, but need the bugs we bring up fixed before we can buy it.

Contact me if you want our company information.

Thanks.
fields.summary: The 'Anyone' group can not be removed from any global permissions, ever.

fields.description:
It seems that jira mangles unicode characters by escaping the HTML escapes for unicode.

Therefore when you create an issue or a comment in other languages other than english, you get characters such as 日本語

Lets try it here: ???.

This is a pretty big bug for us as we are a Japanese company and need multilingual support to work.

We are using Jakarta Tomcat 4.1.12 and Postgresql 7.3.

Postgresql was compiled with:
./configure --prefix=/usr/local --enable-multibyte=UNICODE --enable-locale --with-java --enable-syslog
and installed with initdb --locale="C" -D $PATH_TO_DATA

We really like Jira a lot, and want to buy it, but we need to sort out these bugs first.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Unicode is not being displayed correctly.

fields.description:
All was working fine, after initial setup w/ MySQL.  I have bounced Tomcat and the following appears relating to JIRA ...

2002-12-16 05:50:10 StandardManager[/jira] Cannot serialize session attribute os_security_defaultauthenticator_user for session 5A1A48EB0D8B84004CCD8E0D8E546446
java.io.NotSerializableException: org.apache.log4j.Category


2002-12-16 06:01:49 StandardManager[/jira] Exception loading sessions from persistent storage
java.io.WriteAbortedException: writing aborted; java.io.NotSerializableException: org.apache.log4j.Category


I am on 1.4 on Redhat 7.3
fields.summary: JIRA won't start after Tomcat restart

fields.description:
All issues, that are "Resolved", show up as "Need More Info". Clicking on "Need More Info" shows all issues with status "Resolved".

All "Assigned" issues show up as "In Progress".

All "In Progress" issues show up as "Reopened".

and so on...
fields.summary: Browse Project|Project Summary: categories scrambled

fields.summary: Personal Roadmap crashed (HTTP status 500)
Full Content view: Fix For Version shows always "Unknown"
Full Content view: "Affects Versions" shows only periods

fields.description:
When viewing various JSP's, the display does not reflect any new values.  Hitting F5 (refresh) generally corrects this.

Also, the user list shows no one, when there are at least 2 users defined and their profiles can be seen/updated.

Initially, I used the HSQL driver, and re-deployed the entire JAR ... but now I am using MySQL (latest version) and it is running on Linux Redhat 7.3.
fields.summary: Must hit refresh (F5) in IE to update display on various pages.

fields.description: Jira is a usefull product! It would be even more usefull if you cound search issues matching one or more "fixed in" versions.
fields.summary: Search issues matching "fixed in" versions

fields.description: When creating a new issue and setting the fix version, the web interface does not appear to update this field during the creation.  If you go back to the issue after creation and set the fix version, all is fine.
fields.summary: Fix Version not set on issue creation

fields.description:
Deleting a user has no effect.


How to reproduce:

- Go to User browser
- Click on "View" link for the user to be deleted
- Click on "Delete User" link
- Click on "Delete" button

The User browser view is displayed again and the deleted user is still visible.
fields.summary: Cannot delete a user

fields.description:
I have just tried to migrate JIRA from a MySQL database to use a SQL Server database and when I try an import the data (previously exported from the MySQL database) I get the following error:

Form Errors: 
Exception occurred: com.caucho.xml.XmlParseException: stream:1809: expected character in cdata at `�' (\u0019) 

I have attached the xml file for reference. Until this is fixed I will need to move back to MySQL.
fields.summary: XmlParseException importing data

fields.description:
Newer builds of tomcat exhibit this issue and I imagine it will effect more app servers as time goes on.

File names such as file.name.ext should be changed to a more portable file_name.ext.

Funny though that this happens on both unix and windows.

with the renaming such things as the global.css.jsp are being renamed to global_css.jsp causing style sheets to fail. Various other jsp pages fail as well.

This might be a jdk issue but the point about portable file names stands.
fields.summary: Multi Period File Names getting mangled by newer versions of Tomcat

fields.description: Enter a star ("*" without the quotes) in the Text Search's Query field and start search.
fields.summary: An error occurred searching: com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchException

fields.description: Changed from InProgress to Completed (a user defined state like in-built Fixed). Go back to browse project screen and the same number (5) are listed as In Progress, but when you click on the In Progress icon it only shows the ones that are in progress.
fields.summary: Resolved issues not shown as such

fields.description:
It is possible to open an issue which has "evil" characters contained, JIRA happily accepts the issue.  But it is not possible to display the issue or edit, delete, etc.

One character we found which caused this was the "registered" ascii character Decimal 174, HEX AE.
fields.summary: Issue will not display when evil characters exist in description

fields.description:
The TextArea on the Edit Issue screen for editing the description has missing close tags in the html. 
This may display properly on some browsers, but on Opera the description trails the box and is not editable. Causing it to be impossible to edit issue descriptions.
fields.summary: Description TextArea on EditIssue screen missing closing textarea tag

fields.description: Request to add a function to JIRA to allow performing a selection of bugs (or features, incidents, etc.) for a group of reporters.
fields.summary: Selection of bugs for a group of reporters

fields.description: When exporting to Excel only the first 20 rows are exported. A work-around for this bug is to add ?view=excel&tempMax=100 to your URL.
fields.summary: Excel Export only exports 20 rows

fields.description: After resolving and closing an issue, in the browse project page, the number of issues under Unscheduled are still at the same # as before I closed the issue.  Clicking on Unscheduled shows the proper number of issues.
fields.summary: Issue Count Not Updated

fields.description: After creating a new project, I cannot get an issue to go into Progress.  When I click on the Start Progress Button in Mozilla (latest nightly build), it just takes me to the issue page without changing the status.  Same thing happens inside IE 6.0
fields.summary: Cannot set to In Progress

fields.description:
There seems to be a missing icon for the status of issues:

http://panama.bekk.no/jira/secure/ViewIssue.jspa?key=OSL-1

Cheers,
Aslak
fields.summary: Missing Status Icon

fields.description:
(from Mike Roberts at Thoughtworks)

mike_b_roberts: hello?
bookmarkman_99: hey
bookmarkman_99: how goes it? just about to crash
mike_b_roberts:  pretty good, thanks - had a really quick q and saw you just
posted to j-users. Was wondering if Jira 2 would allow you to select
multiple issue types in a filter (Jira 1 currently just has a drop-down for
issue type) - I'll email you if you want to go to bed!
mike_b_roberts: btw, Jira 2 is going to solve a whole heap of problems round
here! )
bookmarkman_99: heh - uhm, actually it doesn't yet
mike_b_roberts: , even
bookmarkman_99: but with the new query system, there's no reason it couldn't

bookmarkman_99: (ie performance degradation would be v. small)
mike_b_roberts: Shall I add it to jira.atlassian?
bookmarkman_99: yep - sounds like a good idea
bookmarkman_99: what sort of problems?
mike_b_roberts: k - cool, thanks.
mike_b_roberts: Custome fields, mostly
mike_b_roberts: We are using Jira for some weird stuff here along the lines
of project management
bookmarkman_99: right - well, I'd really love if you could try out the EAPs
and let me know if the custom fields do what you want
bookmarkman_99: now is the time to chime up for features while the hood is
open!
mike_b_roberts: e.g. A customer enters an issue for a new *project* they
want, rather than just a new feature
bookmarkman_99: one issue per project?
mike_b_roberts: I'm gonna try. Loads of things on at the moment. I tried EAP
1 but got hit by the new issues bug, but think that got fixed.
bookmarkman_99: now that is a strange idea 
mike_b_roberts: Yeah - we support about 50 different projects in this group
(some of them are *tiny*)
bookmarkman_99: right - yep, fixed - and EAP 2 is even prettier, especially
the new filtering / issue nav UI is much better
mike_b_roberts: btw, I think you should add 'unpriotitised' as a default
priority and 'story' as a default task type. 
bookmarkman_99: hehe default! 
bookmarkman_99: now THAT is a good idea
bookmarkman_99: all constants should have a default choice
mike_b_roberts: Default project in 'new issue' would be good too.
bookmarkman_99: well, that's always the last project you 'touched' -
magicness
mike_b_roberts: Ah, a default default then. 
mike_b_roberts: (In case this is their first visit)
bookmarkman_99: but thep riority is currently always the 'middle one'
mike_b_roberts: Ah, OK.
bookmarkman_99: issue type is always the top one
mike_b_roberts: I just being anal. 
bookmarkman_99: but defaults is a good idea, I can see people using that -
and we can do it very simply in the UI
mike_b_roberts: (/me downloads EAP 2...)
mike_b_roberts: So when do yo the .Net port?!
bookmarkman_99: the what? 
mike_b_roberts: heh
mike_b_roberts: BTW, you know the other download from here the other day?
Thats for a team that are trying actually integrating Jira into a projcet
bookmarkman_99: really? wow - how? having any problems?
mike_b_roberts: There was a project needing some specific issue management
based on some other stuff.
mike_b_roberts: Basically they have a Service grabbing stuff out of an
Oracle DB and are creating issues through the API.
mike_b_roberts: Biggest problem they are having is the API itself - I think
they'd either like more documentation, or to try a SOAP API
bookmarkman_99: ahh ok - well, depending on when their project is due - they
should use 2, it's a much nicer API 
mike_b_roberts: Any chance of a source download?
bookmarkman_99: for 2? Uhm - it's still got a lot of debug / cruft in there
mike_b_roberts: And? 
mike_b_roberts: s'ok, I understand if you don't want it let out
mike_b_roberts: A Javadoc dump for the API at least would be useful though
bookmarkman_99: maybe wih release 3 when we get a few more bugs ironed out,
and the email notification stuff done (one of the last 'majors')
mike_b_roberts: Yeah, Jira 'spam' is a bit of an issue here. 
bookmarkman_99: hehe, we're fixing that - and in style true to atlassian
form, making it 100x better than anywhere else 
bookmarkman_99: (it's seriously funky shit 
mike_b_roberts: Joe and Paul H were singing the praises of your CRM App,
btw. Scott showed them in belgium and they were well impressed
bookmarkman_99: hehe now THAT is some seriously funky shit *g* we have a lot
of 'cool stuff' still to come, don't worry about that 
mike_b_roberts: So are you going to sell the CRM stuff?
bookmarkman_99: possibly - it's a much harder 'sale'
mike_b_roberts: yeah, it wouldn't be something we want here, I guess
bookmarkman_99: I think Confluence will be our next 'released' app, and that
you guys will cream for - it's right up the XP alley
mike_b_roberts: ?
bookmarkman_99: hrm... it's hard to describe, you have to see it - it's like
an online collaborative free form environment, part blog, part wiki - you
can create new 'spaces' (like a wiki in itself) rapidly and bring other
group members in to collaborate in them. 
mike_b_roberts: Ah, OK. I tried snip-snap - it didn't pass the 10 minute
test for me
bookmarkman_99: of course you can let outside people just 'view' - I think
it will be really good for companies to document a software process, manage
projects, share information with customers / clients
bookmarkman_99: why's that? it's pretty cool
bookmarkman_99: of course - it will be integrate with JIRA (two way)
mike_b_roberts: Seemed over complex to me. I love moin moin coz its so
simple
bookmarkman_99: moin moin is simpler? in which way?
mike_b_roberts: You click 'edit' and type.  Can't remember now. Chris and
were looking at it - perhaps we were just having one of those days...
bookmarkman_99: right - well, I'll make sure to keep simplicity high on the
list (it always is)
mike_b_roberts: (/me creates a project)
mike_b_roberts: oooooh - nice bew project admin browser. 
bookmarkman_99: yah, much cleaner
bookmarkman_99: and you no longer lose your navigation if you have lots of
versions / components
mike_b_roberts: btw, we *really* need to eb able to assign 'per-project
admins' here
bookmarkman_99: yah, it's on the 2 list
bookmarkman_99: anyway, I'm crashing but I'll leave this on - feel free to
dump any thoughts, worries, UI improvements (checkout the new issue nav,
shared filters etc - I still think it's not 'quite' right even if it's much
more obvious than the last one)
bookmarkman_99: to this window or email 
mike_b_roberts: I still reckon the version boxes look a bit ugly compared
with everythin else (on 'new issue page 2')
bookmarkman_99: the fix / affects versions select boxes? hard to make them
prettier
mike_b_roberts: Yeah. I reckon it should highlight 'none' and 'unknown'
maybe. And if there aren't any released versions in the project, there
should be the 'Released versions' line in the box
bookmarkman_99: right - maybe, all good little tweaks - keep 'em coming, I'm
bailing - nite mate (or morning 
mike_b_roberts: heh - see ya

So, here's what else I thought of. :) Just my thoughts, so when I say
'should', its just my opinion, right?! :) And its a bit verbose, but
hopefully it will be representative of my immediate emotions. Which is
important when you're selling this thing?!

That whole version thing - the affected and fix for should look more similar
to each other, affected version should also have 'unknown' at the top, and
both boxes should have 'unknown' highlighted by default. Most users (here at
least) don't care about versions. We can always figure that out later
anyway, and they just get confused.

While I think about it, component is the same. As a user, I don't know
necassarily how your components work. Perhaps change 'none' to 'unknown', or
at least highlight 'none'.

Also, if my project doesn't have versions and/or components, I don't care
about them on the new issue screen, so why not either (a) don't show them or
(b) show them disabled? Helps with the whole '10 minute test'

Environment should be below 'description'. We hardly every use it. :)

Perhaps, in fact, you should split page 2 - Page 2a is the mandatory fields,
you then have 2 submit buttons, one takes you to page 2b where you can add
optional fields, and the other just creates the issue there and then. I'd
like that a lot.

Oooh, how about rich text box for description?

OK, created my issue - nice new issue page! :) Ah, but my status is just a
grey box with a dot in it - that ain't intuitive!

Apart from that, it looks nice! Getting rid of all those buttons was a good
idea. While I think of it - watching. Here's a story: 'As a user I want to
be able to configure my profile such that I can choose whether I
automatically watch issues or not when I create them' and 'As a Jira
administrator, I want to be able to be able to configure a default behaviour
for [the previous story] when a user hasn't specified a preference'

BUG! Tried to create another issue - this time I left the component as
'None', and its giving me a big pink bar saying 'Component IDs cannot be
less than zero'.

Another bug - When I browse the project, only 'No component' is listed on
the left hand side of the 'open issues' page, yet the 2 issues I created are
both in a specified component, so when I click the component link nothing
appears. (My extracted XML is at the end of this email)

Another bug - extract xml is hanging when I want to extract to browser
rather than file.

So now to the new 'Find Issues stuff'. First thing - I hadn't set up
indexing, so I went and did that, then hit 'find issues' again, but got the
same page ... because it was cached. We get this a lot - is there anything
more you could do to stop IE caching?

Again, the 'fix for' box problem. I really don't like the whole
'sub-listing' thing in the select box. There has to be a better way.

Why is 'Edit' and 'New' a different pane on the tab, when effectively they
are the same thing? It doesn't seem to fit when the other things on the tab
('View' and 'All') are so different.

Generally - I like having more filter fields in terms of power, but this
screen is getting increasing difficult for new users to comprehend. Any
chance we can break this up a bit?

Bug! 'Reported by' set to 'Any User', clicked 'View >>', got message 'Could
not find username: asdas' ! When I clicked something else, then back to Any
User, and view again, this went away.

Right, so I've got a list of issues now, and status is a little sqaure with
a dot it in again - what gives?

Also, priority column is so narrow, all the title says is 'Pr' - is this a
feature?

OK, I'm going to save this filter now (that's a lot nicer than V1) - the
submit button says 'Save As' - I think 'Save' is fine. 'Save as' implies (to
me) that another dialog is going to appear. And sure enough, you're using
'Save as' for a rename option on the 'view' tab' (which makes sense)

So I'm viewing the filter now, and I get more columns. Any reason why you
have more columns here?

I click a column to re-order and I get 'Modified since loading' as a message
- what does that mean? The data changed? Ah, I see, I have a 'Save' link now
so it means the filter specification has changed (I reordered), which means
you are saving sort orders. Nice. But not obvious. :) Are we going to get
column picking? And can you add an option to generate a URL for any given
filter (so I can link to reports from an intranet site)?

Looking at 'Manage fiilters' - this is a private filter, so we can't share
yet?

So back to the Issue view page.

Bug! I click 'Watch it' and get 'Issue does not exist'. I haven't got SMTP
turned on - is this the problem? And if I have SMTP turned off should I even
have that option? (which brings into to play a whole 'service-dependent UI
options' thing which we better not go near! :) )

OK, lets go play with custom fields. Mmmm - I can add 'Select lists' . Very
nice! :) And you have default options! :D Why are 'Edit' and 'Edit options'
different pages?

Other things - moving issues between projects would be good.

OK, I need to go and do some work now. Overall, there's a load of good new
things in Jira 2, but I've come across a few bugs. I look forward to trying
out later versions! 

Cheers,

Mike
fields.summary: JIRA 2 Feedback and Improvements

fields.description: After a filter is saved first time, one is able to modify by clicking 'Show' to edit filter properties. After the modification is completed, the HTML interface provides 'Save' function to current filter. However, the page behind 'Save' asks a user to type name and description. If the name of existing is typed to the page, JIRA complains that the name already exists.
fields.summary: Unable to update existing filter

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1012].
  {panel}

A few suggestions that I think would improve JIRA from a general project management perspective (and I think they are probably easy to implement to boot).

1.  A 'estimated close date' or 'due date' field for issues (I think this may already be on the list).  Would allow for some basic over/under schedule type metrics.

2.  'target date' and 'release date' tracking on versions (again simple scheduling metrics).

3.  It would be very useful to be able to attach documents to the project itself, not only to issues.  Often a project has high level documents (project charter, licensing docs, coding conventions, etc) that need to be in a highly visible, easily accessible location.  Creating bogus issues to attach then to doesn't work so well (out of sight, out of mind).  It would be great to be able to attach them directly to a project and have them listed on the main project detail screen.

Thanks,

Joe
fields.summary: Project management improvements

fields.description:
When I go into a project and view all the issues with no component, it only brings up one issue when there are supposedly six listed.  The summary pane on the left says:

Resolution: Unresolved
Component: No Component

If I go over to Unscheduled versions, it works properly.

Matt
fields.summary: Browsing for issues with no component doesn't show all issues
Status

fields.description:
Created a new project with several components.
Created several issues and assigned them to various components within project.
However when I browse the project it shows screen for project with 'No component' listed and number of issues, and doesn't list the setup components for project. When I click on 'No component' to see the issues, none are listed.
If I select the issues via 'In Progress' or 'High' priority, the issues are listed, and when I click on an issue it displays the component attribute for the issue.
So the issue does have the component attribute tied to it, but the components don't seem to be linked to the project, at least not on the Browse Project screen.
fields.summary: Components

fields.description: It would be nice to add a CVS URL for browsing CVS trees via ViewCVS or CVSWeb. Right now I'm dropping them into the project description but it would be nice to have the link available on a project and module basis. so when you displayed a project name and/or a module name you could have a simple text link for view cvs or something like that. (maybe a pretty icon)
fields.summary: ViewCVS/CVSWeb Link

fields.description:
In JIRA three different action elements are used: links, buttons and graphics (e.g. the red cross to delete links).

Please cut it down to two elements. Otherwise it confuses the user too much.
fields.summary: Make UI consistent
Road-Map: issues are sorted in reverse order

fields.description:
I added a new Issue Type and by accident presh refresh (F5).

My added Issue Type duplicated and some Icon URL misformed.

Work around was to edit all URL and remove the duplicated Issue Type. Just one Issue Type was removed. I expected both to disappear.
fields.summary: Submitting a new Issue Type and refresh page resubmits and shifts icons

fields.description:
Upon activating the Issue Linking feature, the following text appears on the page:

For the users you wish to be able to work on issues, ensure that they have the Work On Issues permission, either globally or for a particular project. 


I believe this text should refer to the "Link Issue" permission and not the "Work On Issues" permission.
fields.summary: Issue Linking page contains

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1001].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 23 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

This suggestion is a priority for the JIRA development team, but I am not able to provide an accurate estimate for when this will be resolved. We will update this issue as soon as we can confidently project a release.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

Some of our project members are rumbling about having to assign issues, when on some of the other projects this is important.  It seems this (along with some other options, such as mailing and voting) would make more sense as an option on the project rather than on the whole server.
fields.summary: Allow unassigned issues on a per-project basis

fields.description: Would it be possible to see who has voted for certain issues?
fields.summary: View who has voted for issues

fields.description: When I click 'Start Progress' the screen refreshes, but the issue is still displayed 'Unassigned' and the link 'Start Progress' does not change to (presumably) 'Stop Progress'.
fields.summary: My 'Start Progress' link does nothing

fields.description: I've entered my custom field with a description, but this is not shown either on the 'View Custom Fields' page or on the create issue page.
fields.summary: Custom field description not displayed

fields.description:
With the new flexibility to change your statuses, resolutions, severities etc, the help links should really reflect this.  Currently they point to the static pages at Atlassian, which has two drawbacks: 

1. It means they cannot be used from behind a firewall that prevents internet access.  
2. If you've customised Jira and changed the defaults, the help will not help you.

It would be better to generate the help on-the-fly from the descriptions in the database.
fields.summary: Help links may not be helpful

fields.description: The heading at the top of the 'View Custom Fields' page is 'View Statuses'.
fields.summary: Incorrect heading on View Custom Fields

fields.description: Ok, my import worked much better this time and statuses are there.  In the roadmap, however, the progress bar is not displayed and shows 'No issues', which is clearly false.
fields.summary: Progress bar not displayed

fields.description:
You can assign, resolve an issue or start progress on it with separate actions.

Please allow to set fast a new Fix-For-Version without the need to edit the issue, too.
fields.summary: Faster Fix-For-Version switch
Cannot delete a link between issues

fields.description: When I list Issues using any of the Preset Filters, the results display frame, at "Current Filter:" does not show which one I selected. If I use a filter I created, its name appears there when I use it. Unless I misunderstand the display, this is a bug.
fields.summary: Current Filter: does not display names of Preset Filters
